Class MusicPlayer

java.lang.Object
group2.mp3player.model.MusicPlayer
public class MusicPlayer extends Object
The `MusicPlayer` class provides functionalities to play, pause, and manage songs and playlists. It also keeps track of the song history and manages UI components related to music playback.

  • Constructor Details

    • MusicPlayer

      private MusicPlayer()
      Private constructor to prevent instantiation of the MusicPlayer class. The MusicPlayer class is designed to follow the Singleton pattern. To obtain an instance of MusicPlayer, use the getInstance() method.

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize()
      Initializes the MusicPlayer by loading the song history and all songs from their respective JSON files. It also sets the media player volume based on the stored volume preference, if the media player is not null.

    • getInstance

      public static MusicPlayer getInstance()
      Retrieves the singleton instance of the MusicPlayer.
      Returns:
      the singleton instance of MusicPlayer

    • resetInstanceForTesting

      static void resetInstanceForTesting()
      Resets the singleton instance to null This method is only for testing purposes and allows the singleton to be reinitialized. Not to be used in the main production code.

    • getSongHistory

      public javafx.collections.ObservableList<Song> getSongHistory()
      Retrieves the song history as an observable list of songs.
      Returns:
      an ObservableList containing the history of songs that have been played.

    • getAllSongs

      public javafx.collections.ObservableList<Song> getAllSongs()
      Retrieves the complete list of all songs available in the music player.
      Returns:
      an ObservableList containing all the songs.

    • getPlaylists

      public javafx.collections.ObservableList<Playlist> getPlaylists()
      Retrieves the list of playlists available in the music player.
      Returns:
      an ObservableList containing all the playlists.

    • getMediaPlayer

      public javafx.scene.media.MediaPlayer getMediaPlayer()
      Retrieves the media player instance associated with the MusicPlayer.
      Returns:
      the MediaPlayer instance used for playing music.

    • getSongHistoryFile

      public String getSongHistoryFile()
      Retrieves the file path for the song history.
      Returns:
      a String representing the path to the song history file.

    • getAllSongsFile

      public String getAllSongsFile()
      Retrieves the file path for the all songs file.
      Returns:
      a String representing the path to the all songs file.

    • getSavedVolume

      private double getSavedVolume()

    • setLabelsAndProgressBar

      public void setLabelsAndProgressBar(javafx.scene.control.Label songTitleLabel, javafx.scene.control.Label totalTimeLabel, javafx.scene.control.Slider progressBar)
      Sets the labels and progress bar for the music player interface.
      Parameters:
      songTitleLabel - the label to display the song title
      totalTimeLabel - the label to display the total time of the song
      progressBar - the progress bar to show the current position of the song

    • setMediaPlayer

      public void setMediaPlayer(javafx.scene.media.MediaPlayer mediaPlayer)
      Sets the MediaPlayer instance used by the MusicPlayer. Mostly used for testing purposes.
      Parameters:
      mediaPlayer - the MediaPlayer instance to be associated with the MusicPlayer.

    • setVolume

      public void setVolume(double volume)
      Sets the volume for the media player and saves the volume preference.
      Parameters:
      volume - the desired volume level as a double, where 0.0 represents mute and 1.0 represents the maximum volume.

    • getRandomStatus

      public boolean getRandomStatus()

    • saveVolumePreference

      public void saveVolumePreference(double volume)
      Saves the user's volume preference for the music player.
      Parameters:
      volume - the desired volume level as a double, where 0.0 represents mute and 1.0 represents the maximum volume.

    • loadVolumePreference

      public double loadVolumePreference()
      Loads the user's volume preference for the music player from the stored preferences.
      Returns:
      the volume preference as a double, where 1.0 is the default value if no preference is found

    • loadPlaylist

      public javafx.collections.ObservableList<Song> loadPlaylist(String playlistName)
      Loads songs from a selected playlist.
      Parameters:
      playlistName - The name of the playlist to load songs from.
      Returns:
      An ObservableList of songs if the playlist is found, otherwise null.

    • loadPlaylists

      public void loadPlaylists(String playlistsFile, List<String> playlistNames)
      Loads playlists from a specified JSON file and updates the internal playlist list and provided playlist names list.
      Parameters:
      playlistsFile - the path to the JSON file that contains the playlists data.
      playlistNames - a list where the names of the loaded playlists will be added.

    • handlePlayPause

      public void handlePlayPause(Song selectedSong, javafx.scene.control.Button playPauseButton)
      Handles the play and pause functionality for the media player. This method manages the play and pause actions based on the current state of the media player and the provided song selection. If no media player is active, and a song is selected, it initializes the media player with the selected song and starts playback. If the media player is currently playing, it pauses the playback. If the media player is paused, it resumes playback. Additionally, it updates the text of the play/pause button to reflect the current state.
      Parameters:
      selectedSong - the song selected for playback or for resuming from a paused state. This can be null if no song is selected.
      playPauseButton - the button that toggles the play/pause state and whose text is updated based on the state of the media player.

    • handlePrevNext

      public void handlePrevNext(Song selectedSong)
      Handles the action of playing the selected song in the media player, either from a paused state or from an uninitialized state. If the media player is null and a song is selected, it initializes the media player with the selected song and starts playback. If the media player is not null, it pauses the current playback, initializes the media player with the selected song, and starts playback again.
      Parameters:
      selectedSong - the song to be played. If null, no action is performed.

    • initializeMediaPlayer

      private void initializeMediaPlayer(Song selectedSong)
      Initializes the media player with the selected song and starts playback. This method creates a new Media instance using the file path of the selected song. The song is added to the song history and a MediaPlayer is created for the media. The media player is set to automatically play the song. The progress bar is also updated in real-time based on the current playback time.
      Parameters:
      selectedSong - the song that is selected for playback.

    • playSongFromHistory

      public void playSongFromHistory(Song song)
      Plays a song from the song history using the media player. If the media player is not null, it stops the current playback. Then, it initializes the media player with the provided song and starts playback.
      Parameters:
      song - the song to be played from the history.

    • formatTime

      private String formatTime(javafx.util.Duration duration)
      Formats a Duration object into a string representation with the format "m:ss".
      Parameters:
      duration - the duration to be formatted, represented as a Duration object.
      Returns:
      a string representing the formatted time in minutes and seconds.

    • createPlaylist

      public void createPlaylist(String name)
      Creates a new playlist with the specified name and adds it to the list of playlists. The updated list of playlists is then saved to a JSON file named "playlists.json".
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the new playlist to be created.

    • searchPlaylistByName

      public List<String> searchPlaylistByName(String playlistName)
      Searches for playlists whose names match or contain the provided playlist name. If no playlist name is provided, it returns all playlist names.
      Parameters:
      playlistName - the name or partial name of the playlist to search for.
      Returns:
      a list of playlist names that match the search criteria. If the playlistName is null or empty, returns all available playlist names.

    • toggleRandomize

      public void toggleRandomize()
      Toggles the randomize boolean which affects if the next song is the next in the list or a random selection.
